abstract: Adds a context menu to the view.

declaration.code: nonisolated func contextMenu<MenuItems>(_ contextMenu: ContextMenu<MenuItems>?) -> some View where MenuItems : View

overview:
## Return Value

A view that can show a context menu.

## Discussion

Use this method to attach a specified context menu to a view. You can make the context menu unavailable by conditionally passing `nil` as the value for the `contextMenu`.

The example below creates a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ContextMenu] that contains two items and passes them into the modifier. The Boolean value `shouldShowMenu`, which defaults to `true`, controls the context menu availability:

items.description: Sets the title in the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarTitle(_:)

items.description: Sets the title and display mode in the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarTitle(_:displayMode:)

items.description: Sets the navigation bar items for this view.
items.name: navigationBarItems(leading:)

items.description: Sets the navigation bar items for this view.
items.name: navigationBarItems(leading:trailing:)

items.description: Configures the navigation bar items for this view.
items.name: navigationBarItems(trailing:)

items.description: Hides the navigation bar for this view.
items.name: navigationBarHidden(_:)

items.description: Sets the visibility of the status bar.
items.name: statusBar(hidden:)

title: contextMenu(_:)
